Description: Amuletic string: composed of many long truncated convex bicone beads, one broken, some large, all of amethyst, a small amethyst 'ba'-amulet, a small baboon amulet also of amethyst, and five amethyst lenticular beads, generally flattened long convex bicones in shape.
Curator's comments: For 'ba'-amulets, cf. W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Amulets’ (London, 1914), pl.XXXIII, 185e-h: Petrie calls these amulets female sphinxes with cat bodies; H. Junker, ‘Bericht über die Grabungen der Akademie der Wissenschaften in Wein auf den Friedhöfen von el-Kubanieh-Nord. Winter 1910-11’ (Vienna, 1920), pl. 10, group 80. 13.m.3; E. R. Ayrton, C. T Currelly and A. E. P. Weigall, ‘Abydos’ III (London, 1904), pl.XII, group 2; T. E. Peet, ‘The Cemeteries of Abydos, part II. 1911-12’ (London, 1914), pl.x, groups 9, 10; W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Diospolis Parva: the Cemeteries of Abadiyeh and Hu. 1898-9’ (London, 1901), pl.XXVII, group W 38; Earl of Carnarvon & H. Carter, 'Five Years' Exploration at Thebes, 1907-11' (London, 1912), pl.XLVI, 2F: all Middle Kingdom. For baboon amulets, cf. W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Amulets’ (London, 1914), pl.XXXVII, 206; G. Brunton, 'Qau and Badari' II (London, 1927-30), pl.XCIV, class 14; Earl of Carnarvon & H. Carter, 'Five Years' Exploration at Thebes, 1907-11' (London, 1912), pl.XLVI, 2E.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (424)
